Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3rBmiuqA7BfhojxzMva6_Q.text: This was already a great Buffet, and it looks like over time they have stepped it up even more.... and I'm not just talking about the fluffy new carpeting!  There is a wide variety of food items and looks like it's been expanded. The center Island area which is usually just an iversized salad bar at most other buffets has been transformed to include other things as well including a station where you can get Reuben sliders... haven't seen those before at buffets!   My all-time favorite is still the Asian station where you can pick your assortment of vegetables and sauces and give them to the chef for Preparation with meat. I found that this buffet was very satisfying in not only the selection of foods but the quality and taste as well. This would explain the popularity.  The prices are very reasonable, plus if you're staying in the hotel and have a fun booklet you get 50% off. Each night they have a different themed buffet with lots of different selections that I have not seen other places.... so go enjoy their cuisine. I know i did. In fact I was just thinking to myself I don't go there enough!!

photos.caption: Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

72gsio-QGQFrkXj84P4Prw.text: PRICE: for the price, you really can't beat it. I used to always stop in on my way in and stop in on my way out of Vegas. Super duper affordable even if you aren't a card member. $10 ish for breakfast and $13 ish for lunch. Seafood or prime rib days may bring you closer to $20   LOCATION: inside Southpoint hotel and casino (before you hit The Strip if coming from CA). The casino used to not be so busy but it has gotten kind of busy since they have a large arena for events (particularly rodeo and equine events).   Also, I saw David Archuleta at Garden Buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts
Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch

VBgnF2aExm8B7N_0bm-Clw.text: Prime Rib Brunch on the weekend, was good. My prime rib was near perfect. My wife had some that was rare. She gave it to me and it was also good, though I prefer it medium. Twelve flavors of gelato with the desserts and there was champaign and mimosa to drink. The desserts were high quality and very good. Also loved the ribs I ate. Think they were pork ribs, though they were pretty big. All the food was high quality, fresh and tasted great.   At times, the waitress was slow to come by to remove the used plates and my soft drink ran out before she was there to fill it. Not a major problem.  I signed up for a players' card, which gave me a $4.00 reduction on each buffet. (Two maximum for each card).   There was a short wait, to get in to the buffet.

o_bXHQ7_8RlyaJIRQqucSQ.text: Decent buffet.  Came here on a Wednesday night and the price was under $20.  Asian Food included duck and bbq pork. (Very uncommon to see duck on menus theses days at a casino buffet).  Bbq area included ribs, pork loin, chicken, and a guy doing the prime rib.  Italian was good...included calzone and 3 different kind of pizzas.  Seafood included shrimp and fish.  Desserts included baked items and ice cream.  Salad bar had plenty.  There was even a guy doing sliders.  Overall, it received a 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jxACF22Obfg-_SVAXNFyiA.text: No.  It IS as bad as the reviews say.  Friday night: Seafood & Prime Rib  I sampled: prime rib, smoked pork ribs, smoked garlic salmon, glazed salmon, fried shrimp, fresh oysters, oysters Rockefeller, fried scallops, baked salmon, roast duck, Chinese vegetables, sushi, steamed won tons, made to order shrimp tacos, 3 flavors of gelato, bread pudding, and crepes, so I think it's safe to say I gave this buffet a fair try. Didn't even need to try the crab legs, obviously from frozen, the meat looked dry and was shriveled up inside and had pulled away completely from the shell.   The first thing I noticed when I walked in was that it smelled kind of fishy. Mm..not a good sign. We were starving, we purveyed the food and it all looked good! LOOKED. Huge prime rib fans so basically the fact that it was there was enough for us to sit down. Prime rib...I mean if a buffet serves it, it's usually at least halfway decent.  Prime rib was overcooked, cold, and chewy. Pork rib, not chewy, also not falling off the bone tender, also cold, and dry. No BBQ sauce? I thought maybe I missed it so I went back, I asked the chef behind the counter if they had bbq sauce, he went to the back and filled up one of those plastic salsa containers and gave me some bbq sauce...ummmm if you HAVE bbq sauce why is it not outside on the line NEXT to the PORK RIBS? Fried shrimp was pretty good, from frozen but good enough to eat as they were at least hot.  Smoked salmon did have a smoky flavor, other than that pretty tasteless. I sniffed the oyster and decided no. I sniffed the oysters Rockefeller and said MAYBE, I tasted a tiny piece and it was a no. Fried scallops, bleh, from frozen, bready and mushy on the inside :( The sushi, I know this because this I have done this exact same thing and gotten the same result. They are rolled the day or night before and put in the FRIDGE and then pulled out for service. THAT IS WHY THE RICE IS HARD. Also lacking in any "expensive" varieties. You know what I mean.  The roast duck was pretty good actually, it was hot, juicy, tender, and had the fatty skin on it. The Chinese Vegetables were pretty good as well (stir fried baby bok choy and baby carrots) the carrots were from frozen, but of all frozen vegetables to use, it is the least offensive.   Made to Order Station Shrimp Tacos..............You know those itty bitty frozen cheap shrimp that they use for popcorn shrimp. That was the shrimp they used for these tacos. I found these abhorrent little shrimps used OVER and OVER again in every single fucking dish of this buffet, mixed into pasta, served in tomato sauce, in cream sauce, in stir fry, the only exception was the shrimp cocktail. They used the worst possible choice of tortilla, first of all. They were these really thick and gummy flour tortillas that overpowered everything. The shrimp I don't think were seasoned whatsoever. Also they were not hot, and neither was the tortilla. If it's a "made to order" item, make it to order -_- The shrimps were already cooked, sitting in a pan, and he halfassedly "heated" my tortillas for all of 5 seconds. No he wasn't busy.   The crepes, oh god...another "made to order" item LOL. Looked good enough so we grabbed one. Ummmm why is it so hard? I tried to cut it with my spoon and it had gelatinized with the syrup that had been poured over it god knows how long ago. It smelled like fake citrus...and then I realized there were canned mandarin oranges sitting on top and I was done with that. I love how they present their ice cream in those metal pans like they're gelato, I'm not even sure what's in them can pass for ice cream. No richness, icy, poor mouthfeel, not creamy :( The bread pudding was pretty good!  I am beyond baffled. We paid $60 for the 2 of us and that was the "club member" price. Why on earth ANYONE would pay that much to eat here is BEYOND me. It's literally 5 more dollars to eat at Rio's Carnival buffet and it's ten times better, PECHANGA is cheaper and twice as good, a chicken sandwich from Carl's Jr. would have been better, ordering appetizers, entrees, and dessert at a fucking APPLEBEES would have been a better use of money. Literally, I wish we would have gone anywhere else. And this is what I get for not checking yelp before I eat.

3oZz2XrwJZTAirqU1VpRkA.text: Was hungry.  They have great prices. Prime rib, potstickers, Chinese pork, carne asada with peppers, and tons of soup choices.  If you're in the area, give it a try!

0fYUtE-90MKXbb1rAalmQQ.text: Uhmmmm.... why does this place have more than two stars? Honestly it was probably the worst Buffet or one of the most worst buffets I've ever had. Every single dish I tried during their lunch buffet was bland or dry looking or just simply tasted horrible. Their breakfast buffet is awesome but their lunch buffet is just horrible.....

NmNSIVlSgr5OG63ee8QVNg.text: As far as buffets go it is a wonderful garden of different flavors. Oh so delicious offerings from prime rib, tacos, sushi, rabbit food and ending with delectable dessert.  When one has teenagers, you understand that they are always hungry. Seems that if you have twin teenagers you get twice the fun. Basking in all that glory they were really hungry, I'm sure that the cold winter days do not help either. Thinking and hoping that this buffet will quell their green hulk healthy appetite, it appears I have a winner. There is something for all here. From the most finicky of esters there is something for everyone here. The diversity of different cuisines offered is so massive. As I said before one can have tacos and sushi, then a garden salad, don't forget all the desserts; plus what about the ultimate food there's always room for. Any guess? This food comes in a song! There's always room for, sing it, J-E-L-L-O!  The taste of the food here at this buffet is so mouthwatering deliciousness! As I write this, it resonates the tastes that I explored here. Such tantalizing temptation at every turn! The prime rib was what we explored this trip, with the experience being superb. As we were seated by the wait staff, it was a colorful booth that was particularly comfortable. The server took our drink order and it's off to grab a plate.   The prime rib was my first stop, having a meat craving at the time sounds like a good reason for steak. The prime rib was lean and as he sliced it the knife went through it instantly as if with no effort. The juices were delicious. I had to have potatoes and if you ask they will give you the prime rib juice as gravy if you want this. They have a brown gravy and a standard looking gravy that's white appearance looked better. The only way the prime rib could get any better is with it wrapped in bacon. They don't offer that on their prime rib here. Darn!  After prime rib the salad bar looked mighty good as I walked by with the plate of prime rib. The salad bar has fresh greens and so many choices. They offer spinach, a mixed greens with kale and spinach, then the "normal" looking lettuce. For my salad I had the spinach and kale mix and went heavy on the spinach. It's so good for you. The toppings are plentiful, from peas, cheeses both white and yellow, olives and the list goes on. I am an olive fan by far, here at the bowl of green olives let's see how my plate will look. Let's just say that it's all full. I am a big fan of cucumbers too. They leave some of the green part of the skin on the cucumbers that are cut into hexagons. They are so cute. With bleu cheese to top off the salad it's time to go eat the salad, with a side of green olives. Oh me oh my where will I put round two of the salad bar. The twins love salad too, they have already finished their plates and are here getting plate two on salad. Where do they put all that   Skipping to the good stuff, let's move to dessert! For those of us that can enjoy dessert with no issues, then we are the lucky few. For those individuals that still love dessert, but medically cannot eat it South Point to the rescue. They offer sugar free desserts. The sugar free treats are available in chocolate and raspberry flavors. Really I tried some of the sugar free treats and their was no difference in taste. All of the treats come in mini sizes with flavors such as fruit tarts, carrot cake, chocolate cake, a raspberry flavored something that really is so delicious. Did I mention the ice cream? No, I didn't. The ice cream is soft serve that only has three flavors of vanilla, chocolate, and twist. The sprinkles are a celebration of the rainbow these go on the top. Now that you have ice cream and cake with sprinkles it's time to find the spoon. Get set, commence eating!   As we walk back and forth indulging ourselves plate after plate, and round after round. Whom do we have to thank for clearing our plates. We have the diligent staff that just clears the table and then melt into the back ground again. These are the same employees that keep our water cups filled too. They ask for nothing, but are expected to do so very much. I want to take this chance and thank all the employees here for all of the wonderful work that they performed for my family during our dining experience. It made eating so enjoyable not having to move this plate or that one. They provided clean silverware each time so that for each course that we enjoyed we had clean utensils. This buffet has some of the best and dedicated employees that I have ever had the privilege to enjoy as a customer. The "adult" drinks I had to walk over to the bar and retrieve my own wine with the drink coupons I was given after I paid. Now cheers to enjoying it!

Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad !

0t7z4jHK1Dfk-Uj7AZURkQ.text: South Point buffet. What can I say, not worth the $$$ in comparison to the majority of other buffets. Also this buffet is pretty pricey. There was nothing exciting worth mentioning at this buffet.  I really have to put in a reminder to not come here again, it's really not worth it, the value is simply not there.

Photo of Garden Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
